Hm, I think you've covered a lot of the steps correctly.
But, what about [email purposes](https://docs.kentico.com/documentation/business-users/digital-marketing/emails#email-purposes)? Currently the [Email Builder only supports Regular and Automation purposes](https://docs.kentico.com/x/email_builder_xp).
We plan to add more in the future, but for now you can use Confirmation and Form autoresponder.
There's an easy workaround for Form autoresponder emails - use Automations instead and use the Email automation step to send the form submitter a confirmation email.
For recipient list confirmation emails, you'll need to continue using [the macro-based template email templates](https://docs.kentico.com/x/eRT_Cw) until we support more purposes. This is what I'm doing in the Kentico Community Portal - all emails use the Email Builder except for [the newsletter sign-up opt-in email](https://github.com/Kentico/community-portal/blob/v30.6.0.1/src/Kentico.Community.Portal.Web/App_Data/CIRepository/KenticoCommunityEmails/contentitemdata.ke..autoresponderemail%4079a961133c/communitynewslette..e81b700645e6_en-us%405f51aa35b7/087aacd3-156b-492a-a7b9-6bb3c9727e11.xml), which is still using the old macro templates.
